attributes.title: Why
attributes.review:
Now and then I think of when we were together
Like when you said you felt so happy you could die
Told myself that you were right for me
But felt so lonely in your company
But that was love and it's an ache I still remember
You can get addicted to a certain kind of sadness
Like resignation to the end, always the end
So when we found that we could not make sense
Well you said that we would still be friends
But I'll admit that I was glad it was over
But you didn't have to cut me off
Make out like it never happened and that we were nothing
And I don't even need your love
But you treat me like a stranger and that feels so rough
No, you didn't have to stoop so low
Have your friends collect your records and then change your number
I guess that I don't need that though
Now you're just somebody that I used to know
Now you're just somebody that I used to know
Now you're just somebody that I used to know
Now and then I think of all the times you screwed me over
But had me believing it was always something that I'd done
But I don't wanna live that way
Reading into every word you say
You said that you could let it go
And I wouldn't catch you hung up on somebody that you used to know
But you didn't have to cut me off
Make out like it never happened and that we were nothing
And I don't even need your love
But you treat me like a stranger and that feels so rough
No, you didn't have to stoop so low
Have your friends collect your records and then change your number
I guess that I don't need that though
Now you're just somebody that I used to know
Somebody (I used to know)
(Somebody) Now you're just somebody that I used to know
Somebody (I used to know)
(Somebody) Now you're just somebody that I used to know
I used to know, that I used to know, I used to know somebody

attributes.title: Disturbing app don’t get 👹
attributes.review: This app is terrifying! I opened the app and I saw a big scary orange man on my screen and it almost made me YEEET my phone across the room. Don’t get this app, it is cursed and will scar you for life! 💩

attributes.title: oh god
attributes.review: i haveDownload this app. And oh my God I opened it and the first thing I see is a Chito head and It had hair it was so scary my five-year-old saw this and she’s been peeing the bed ever cents then i went Farther into the app and I Couldn’t go any further I been having nightmares every night I’ve been sleeping with my daughter I just can’t believe that a Chido with hair is scaring me 😩😩😩😩

attributes.title: KILLED MY MOTHER
attributes.review: hey yo my name is daniel and this is my experience with this app. i love trumpie with all my heart and wanted to support him by getting this app. WRONG. took 6 weeks to download. i opened it and it immediately crashed my phone and gave me an error message. i threw my phone across the room in frustration and it struck my mom, sharon, straight in the maga hat. she died in the hospital. fly high

attributes.title: Good idea, terrible execution.
attributes.review: I downloaded this app as soon as I heard about it and had high expectations. Instead, I was bar-rated with ads and spam. I now get a dozen emails throughout the day, and I think this app is just a plain scam. I’m ashamed of the developers of this app and the outcome. Don’t waste your time.

attributes.title: no❤️
attributes.review:
for all the ‘conservatives’ out there; just realize that all of your iqs combined (and may i add that will be rare to see it to be at least -1000) will not even compare to all of us gen z’s, even if we aren’t even 30 years old. why not let us suffer even more when you’re ignorant enough to actually listen to our arguments instead of whatever your definition of “refuting” them, aka “❄️” or “trump 2020.” let this be know to every single karen, nick, jeremy, or any “right” sided people with trump, your opinions or ideas for the future won’t matter for you since you and your high cholesterol system won’t make it past 53. this is for the future of the YOUTH, and i don’t see any youth on your side.

when you say “respect your elders,” we expect respect back. mwah xoxo
